result.execSummary:
The defendant Kevin J. Schlough was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of THC [Modifiers: Repeater], an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
1:07 PM Defendant Kevin J. Schlough in court.  Attorney John Andrew Newton in court for Kevin J. Schlough.  Attorney Rick C Spoentgen in court for State of Wisconsin.  Court states cases and appearances.  Court notes she understands the DE will waive his right to prelims in 22CF193 and 21CF598 and then proceed to arraignment.  Atty Newton is in agreement.  Court questions DE on prelim waiver/accepts/finds probable cause/binds DE over in 22CF193 and 21CF598.  Atty Newton acknowledges rec. informations/waives reading.  Court advises DE of charges/max penalties in those 2 informations.  State states the joint recommendations on all four cases.  Victim rights have been complied with.  Atty Newton is in agreement, as is the DE.  Court questions DE on the plea agreement.  DE pleads guilty to the agreed counts.  Court accepts pleas/finds DE guilty.  State makes statement on behalf of the joint recommendations.  Atty Newton makes statement on behalf of the DE.  DE has nothing to add.  Court admonishes DE and sentences.  Any cash bonds posted to be applied.
